level.text: The District Department of the Environment, in conjunction with the District of Columbia Public Schools, the Department of Parks and Recreation, the Public Charter School Board, the Office of the State Superintendent of Education, the State Board of Education, and the University System of the District of Columbia, shall develop an environmental literacy plan for public schools and public charter schools.
The environmental literacy plan shall, at minimum, describe the following:
Relevant teaching and learning standards adopted by the State Board of Education;
Governmental and nongovernmental entities that can assist schools; and
The District Department of the Environment shall transmit the environmental literacy plan to the Mayor and the Council by June 30, 2012.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 19-37 designated the existing text as subsec. (a); and added subsecs. (b) and (c).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 2(j) of Healthy Schools Emergency Amendment Act of 2011 (D.C. Act 19-143, August 9, 2011, 58 DCR 6814).

level.text: For history of Law 19-37, see notes under § 38-821.01.
